hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: We were at school together yinopharma-heparin.com In 2012, the 88-win Tigers went directly into the best-of-five ALDS because they won the awful Central division, while the 93-win Orioles and 93-win Rangers had to play in the one-game wild-card playoff (and the 90-win Rays and 89-win Angels were completely left out of the postseason). That's not right, and it's easily correctable. I don't believe the wild-card teams (ideally, in a division-free setup, teams finishing with the fourth- and fifth-best records in the league) should be on equal footing, as was essentially the case during the one-wild-card-team era.
